description: A security issue was discovered in  ingress-nginx https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx  where the `auth-tls-match-cn` Ingress annotation can be used to inject configuration into nginx. This can lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the ingress-nginx controller, and disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. (Note that in the default installation, the controller can access all Secrets cluster-wide.)
summary: A vulnerability in ingress-nginx allows attackers to inject code into nginx using a specific Ingress annotation, leading to arbitrary code execution and potential exposure of Secrets stored by the controller. This affects users of Kubernetes using ingress-nginx. To protect against this threat, users should update to the latest version of ingress-nginx and apply any relevant patches or fixes.

description: A security issue was discovered in  ingress-nginx https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx  where the `mirror-target` and `mirror-host` Ingress annotations can be used to inject arbitrary configuration into nginx. This can lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the ingress-nginx controller, and disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. (Note that in the default installation, the controller can access all Secrets cluster-wide.)
summary: This security issue in the ingress-nginx software allows attackers to inject harmful code into the system, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution and exposing sensitive data. Users of ingress-nginx are at risk of being affected by this vulnerability. To mitigate the threat, users should update their software to the latest version that includes a patch for this issue.

description: A security issue was discovered in Kubernetes where under certain conditions, an unauthenticated attacker with access to the pod network can achieve arbitrary code execution in the context of the ingress-nginx controller. This can lead to disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. (Note that in the default installation, the controller can access all Secrets cluster-wide.)
summary: This security vulnerability in Kubernetes allows an unauthorized attacker to execute code and access sensitive information such as secrets. It affects any organizations using Kubernetes with the ingress-nginx controller. To protect against this threat, it is recommended to update the Kubernetes software to the latest version and restrict access to the pod network to only trusted users.

description: A security issue was discovered in  ingress-nginx https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx  where attacker-provided data are included in a filename by the ingress-nginx Admission Controller feature, resulting in directory traversal within the container. This could result in denial of service, or when combined with other vulnerabilities, limited disclosure of Secret objects from the cluster.
summary: This security issue in the ingress-nginx software can allow attackers to access and manipulate files within a container, potentially leading to denial of service or exposure of sensitive information. Users of ingress-nginx should update to the latest version to mitigate this risk.

description: A security issue was discovered in  ingress-nginx https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx  where the `auth-url` Ingress annotation can be used to inject configuration into nginx. This can lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the ingress-nginx controller, and disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. (Note that in the default installation, the controller can access all Secrets cluster-wide.)
summary: The security issue in the ingress-nginx software allows attackers to inject malicious configuration through the `auth-url` annotation, which can result in executing arbitrary code and leaking sensitive information like Secrets. This impacts users of the ingress-nginx software, which is commonly used in Kubernetes environments. It is recommended to update the software to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in D-Link DIR-823X 240126/240802. This issue affects the function sub_41710C of the file /goform/diag_nslookup of the component HTTP POST Request Handler. The manipulation of the argument target_addr leads to os command injection. The attack may be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: A critical vulnerability has been discovered in the D-Link DIR-823X router, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands on the device by manipulating certain parameters. This vulnerability affects users of this specific model of D-Link routers and can be exploited remotely. It is recommended to update the firmware of the router to the latest version to patch this vulnerability and prevent potential attacks.

description: A vulnerability was found in GNOME libgsf up to 1.14.53 and classified as problematic. Affected by this issue is the function gsf_base64_encode_simple. The manipulation of the argument size leads to use of uninitialized variable. The attack needs to be approached locally. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: The GNOME libgsf software has a vulnerability that could be exploited by an attacker to use uninitialized variables via a function called gsf_base64_encode_simple. This vulnerability can be used by someone with local access to the system. It is recommended to update GNOME libgsf to the latest version to fix this issue. The vendor has been notified about the vulnerability but has not responded.

description: A vulnerability was found in GNOME libgsf up to 1.14.53. It has been classified as critical. This affects the function gsf_base64_encode_simple. The manipulation of the argument size_t leads to heap-based buffer overflow. An attack has to be approached locally. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: The vulnerability in GNOME libgsf could allow an attacker to remotely execute code on a targeted system through a heap-based buffer overflow. This threat impacts users of GNOME libgsf up to version 1.14.53. To mitigate this risk, users should update to the latest version of GNOME libgsf as soon as possible.

description: A vulnerability was found in GNOME libgsf up to 1.14.53. It has been declared as critical. This vulnerability affects the function gsf_prop_settings_collect_va. The manipulation of the argument n_alloced_params leads to heap-based buffer overflow. Local access is required to approach this attack. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: This vulnerability in GNOME libgsf up to version 1.14.53 allows for a critical heap-based buffer overflow attack. It can only be accessed locally, meaning the attacker needs physical access to the device. The vendor has not responded to this disclosure. Users should be aware of this vulnerability, consider restricting physical access to their devices, and look out for any updates or patches from the vendor to address this issue.

description: A vulnerability was found in GNOME libgsf up to 1.14.53. It has been rated as critical. This issue affects the function gsf_property_settings_collec. description: A Server-Side Request Forgery vulnerability in the APROL Web Portal used in B&R APROL <4.4-00P5 may allow an unauthenticated network-based attacker to force the web server to request arbitrary URLs.
summary: This vulnerability in the APROL Web Portal could allow a hacker to manipulate the web server into requesting unauthorized URLs. This could potentially lead to unauthorized access or other malicious activities. Users of B&R APROL <4.4-00P5 should update to a patched version as soon as possible to mitigate this threat.

description: A Server-Side Request Forgery vulnerability in the APROL Web Portal used in B&R APROL <4.4-00P5 may allow an authenticated network-based attacker to force the web server to request arbitrary URLs.
summary: This vulnerability in the APROL Web Portal allows a malicious attacker who is connected to the same network to trick the server into accessing malicious websites without the user's consent. This can potentially lead to unauthorized access or manipulation of sensitive data. Users of B&R APROL software version <4.4-00P5 should update to the latest version to patch this vulnerability and prevent unauthorized access to their network.

description: An Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation vulnerability in the APROL Web Portal used in B&R APROL <4.4-00P5 may allow an authenticated network-based attacker to insert malicious code which is then executed in the context of the user’s browser session.
summary: This vulnerability in the APROL Web Portal software could allow a hacker to insert malicious code into web pages and potentially compromise the user's browser session. It affects users of B&R APROL software versions older than 4.4-00P5. Users should update to the latest version of the software to mitigate this threat.

description: An Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource vulnerability in the file system used in B&R APROL <4.4-01 may allow an authenticated local attacker to read and alter the configuration of another engineering or runtime user.
summary: This vulnerability in B&R APROL <4.4-01 file system could allow a local attacker to access and change the configurations of other users. Users of this software should update to version 4.4-01 or newer to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive information.

description: An improper control of generation of code ('Code Injection') vulnerability in the AprolCreateReport component of B&R APROL <4.4-00P5 may allow an unauthenticated network-based attacker to read files from the local system.
summary: This vulnerability in B&R APROL software allows hackers to access files on a system without being authenticated. This can affect anyone using APROL software version less than 4.4-00P5. Users should update to the latest version to protect their data.

description: An Incomplete Filtering of Special Elements vulnerability in scripts using the SSH server on B&R APROL <4.4-00P5 may allow an authenticated local attacker to authenticate as another legitimate user.
summary: This vulnerability in the B&R APROL software allows a local attacker to potentially impersonate another user by exploiting incomplete filtering of special elements in scripts using the SSH server. Users of B&R APROL <4.4-00P5 should update to the latest version to mitigate this threat.

description: An Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere vulnerability in the SSH server on B&R APROL <4.4-00P1 may allow an authenticated local attacker from a trusted remote server to execute malicious commands.
summary: This vulnerability in the SSH server on B&R APROL <4.4-00P1 could allow a hacker who is authenticated on a trusted remote server to execute harmful commands. Users of B&R APROL <4.4-00P1 should update to the latest version to patch this vulnerability and prevent unauthorized access to their system.

description: A Missing Authentication for Critical Function vulnerability in the GRUB configuration used B&R APROL <4.4-01 may allow an unauthenticated physical attacker to alter the boot configuration of the operating system.
summary: This vulnerability in the GRUB configuration in B&R APROL software may be exploited by a physical attacker without authentication, allowing them to change the boot configuration of the system. This could lead to unauthorized access or control over the system. Users should update to version 4.4-01 or newer to address this issue and prevent potential attacks.

description: An Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling vulnerability in the operating system network configuration used in B&R APROL <4.4-00P5 may allow an unauthenticated adjacent attacker to per-form Denial-of-Service (DoS) attacks against the product.
summary: This vulnerability in the B&R APROL operating system network configuration could allow an attacker nearby to launch a Denial-of-Service attack on the product without needing any authentication. To protect against this, users should update to version 4.4-00P5 or higher.

description: An Exposure of Sensitive System Information to an Unauthorized Control Sphere and Initialization of a Resource with an Insecure Default vulnerability in the SNMP component of B&R APROL <4.4-00P5 may allow an unauthenticated adjacent-based attacker to read and alter configuration using SNMP.
summary: This vulnerability in the SNMP component of B&R APROL software could allow an attacker in close proximity to the system to access and change sensitive configuration information using SNMP. Users of B&R APROL software version <4.4-00P5 should update to the latest version to patch this vulnerability and prevent unauthorized access.

description: An Incorrect Implementation of Authentication Algorithm and Exposure of Data Element to Wrong Ses-sion vulnerability in the session handling used in B&R APROL <4.4-00P5 may allow an authenticated network attacker to take over a currently active user session without login credentials.
summary: This vulnerability in B&R APROL <4.4-00P5 could allow a hacker on the same network to take control of a user's session without needing to log in. Users of this software should update to the latest version to patch this vulnerability and prevent unauthorized access to their accounts.

description: An Improper Handling of Insufficient Permissions or Privileges vulnerability in scripts used in B&R APROL <4.4-00P5 may allow an authenticated local attacker to read credential information.
summary: This vulnerability in B&R APROL software could allow a local attacker with access to the system to read credential information. This vulnerability affects users of B&R APROL version <4.4-00P5. Users should update to the latest version of the software to patch this security issue.

description: The IP Based Login WordPress plugin before 2.4.1 does not have CSRF checks in some places, which could allow attackers to make logged in users delete all logs via a CSRF attack
summary: The IP Based Login WordPress plugin has a security vulnerability that could allow attackers to delete all logs by making a logged-in user unknowingly perform a malicious action. This affects users of the plugin before version 2.4.1. To protect against this threat, users should update the plugin to the latest version, which includes CSRF checks to prevent such attacks.

description: The AFI  WordPress plugin before 1.100.0 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).
summary: The AFI WordPress plugin before version 1.100.0 is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks, which could be exploited by high privilege users like admins. This vulnerability could affect WordPress websites using this plugin, especially in a multisite setup. Users should update the plugin to version 1.100.0 or higher to protect against this threat.

description: The AFI  WordPress plugin before 1.100.0 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).
summary: The AFI WordPress plugin is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks, which could allow high privilege users, such as administrators, to inject malicious code into the plugin settings. This vulnerability affects users of the plugin version before 1.100.0, especially those using it in a multisite setup. Users should update to version 1.100.0 or later to protect against this threat.

description: The aoa-downloadable WordPress plugin through 0.1.0 doesn't validate a parameter in its download function, allowing unauthenticated attackers to download arbitrary files from the server
summary: . This vulnerability affects users of the aoa-downloadable plugin for WordPress. Attackers can exploit this vulnerability to download sensitive files from the server without authentication. Users should update to a version higher than 0.1.0 to mitigate this threat.

description: The aoa-downloadable WordPress plugin through 0.1.0 lacks authorization and authentication for requests to its download.php endpoint, allowing unauthenticated visitors to make requests to arbitrary URLs.
summary: The aoa-downloadable WordPress plugin version 0.1.0 has a security vulnerability that allows unauthorized users to make requests to any URL through its download.php endpoint. This can potentially lead to data theft or unauthorized access to sensitive information. Users of this plugin should update to the latest version or consider disabling it until a fix is available.

description: The Stylish Google Sheet Reader 4.0  WordPress plugin before 4.1 does not sanitise and escape a parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin
summary: The Stylish Google Sheet Reader 4.0 WordPress plugin has a security vulnerability that allows for a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting attack. This could affect high privilege users, such as admins of websites using this plugin. To mitigate this threat, it is recommended to update the plugin to version 4.1 or higher, which includes a fix for this issue.
software: Stylish Google Sheet Reader 4.0 WordPress plugin

description: SQL Injection can occur in the SirsiDynix Horizon Information Portal (IPAC20) through 3.25_9382; however, a patch is available from the vendor. This is in ipac.jsp in a SELECT WHERE statement, in a part of the uri= variable in the second part of the full= inner variable.
summary: This CVE is about a vulnerability in SirsiDynix Horizon Information Portal that allows hackers to perform SQL Injection attacks. This can affect users of the IPAC20 version 3.25_9382. To protect against this threat, users should apply the patch provided by the vendor.

description: The WP-Recall  WordPress plugin before 16.26.12 does not sanitize and escape a parameter before using it in a SQL statement, allowing admins to perform SQL injection attacks
summary: A vulnerability in the WP-Recall WordPress plugin allows hackers to perform SQL injection attacks due to lack of proper sanitization of data. This could affect users of the plugin who have not updated to version 16.26.12. Users should update to the latest version to protect against this threat.

summary: CVE-2021-44228 is a vulnerability in the Apache Log4j software library that could allow attackers to remotely execute code on affected systems. This vulnerability affects any organization or individual using a product or service that utilizes the Apache Log4j library. To mitigate the risk, users should update to the latest version of the Apache Log4j library and monitor for any suspicious activity on their systems.

description: The DesignThemes Core Features plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via shortcodes in versions up to, and including, 4.8 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
summary: The DesignThemes Core Features plugin for WordPress has a security vulnerability that allows attackers with contributor-level permissions or higher to inject harmful scripts into web pages. This could affect anyone using this plugin on their WordPress site. Users should update to version 4.9 or higher to protect against this threat.
software: DesignThemes Core Features plugin for WordPress

description: The Favorites WordPress plugin before 2.3.5 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).
summary: This vulnerability in the Favorites WordPress plugin could allow high privilege users to insert harmful code into the website, potentially affecting all users. To protect against this, users should update the plugin to version 2.3.5 or higher.

description: The  does not sanitise and escape some parameters when outputting them back in a page, allowing unauthenticated users the ability to perform stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks.
summary: This vulnerability allows unauthorized users to execute malicious scripts on a web page, posing a security threat. It affects users who are not authenticated on the website. To mitigate this risk, it is recommended to implement proper sanitization and escape mechanisms for output parameters on the page.

description: Mbed TLS before 2.28.10 and 3.x before 3.6.3, on the client side, accepts servers that have trusted certificates for arbitrary hostnames unless the TLS client application calls mbedtls_ssl_set_hostname.
summary: A vulnerability in Mbed TLS allows malicious servers to use trusted certificates for any hostname without proper verification. This affects Mbed TLS versions before 2.28.10 and 3.x before 3.6.3 on the client-side. To mitigate this threat, TLS client applications should call mbedtls_ssl_set_hostname to ensure proper hostname verification.

description: Mbed TLS before 2.28.10 and 3.x before 3.6.3, in some cases of failed memory allocation or hardware errors, uses uninitialized stack memory to compose the TLS Finished message, potentially leading to authentication bypasses such as replays.
summary: This security vulnerability in Mbed TLS can allow attackers to bypass authentication and potentially carry out replays by exploiting uninitialized stack memory when composing the TLS Finished message. It affects versions before 2.28.10 and 3.x before 3.6.3. Users should update to the latest version of Mbed TLS to mitigate this risk.

description: The Directorist: AI-Powered Business Directory Plugin with Classified Ads Listings plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access  and modification of data due to a missing capability check on the 'parse_query' function in all versions up to, and including, 8.2. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to update the post_status of any post to 'publish'.
summary: The Directorist plugin for WordPress is at risk of unauthorized access and data modification. This vulnerability could affect any website using this plugin up to version 8.2. Website owners should update to the latest version of the plugin to protect against potential attacks.
software: Directorist: AI-Powered Business Directory Plugin with Classified Ads Listings

This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to extract private post titles of downloads. The impact here is minimal.
summary: The Easy Digital Downloads plugin for WordPress has a vulnerability that allows hackers to access private post titles of downloads. This may not have a significant impact, but it is still a security risk for users. Users should update to version 3.3.7 or later to protect their private information.
software: Easy Digital Downloads – eCommerce Payments and Subscriptions made easy plugin

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, was found in Open Asset Import Library Assimp 5.4.3. This affects the function Assimp::CSMImporter::InternReadFile of the file code/AssetLib/CSM/CSMLoader.cpp of the component CSM File Handler. The manipulation leads to out-of-bounds write. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: The Open Asset Import Library Assimp version 5.4.3 has a critical vulnerability that allows remote attackers to carry out out-of-bounds write attacks through the CSM File Handler component. This could affect users of this library who have not updated to the latest version. Users should update to the latest version of the library to mitigate the threat of potential attacks.

description: A vulnerability has been found in Open Asset Import Library Assimp 5.4.3 and classified as problematic. This vulnerability affects the function Assimp::CSMImporter::InternReadFile of the file code/AssetLib/CSM/CSMLoader.cpp of the component CSM File Handler. The manipulation of the argument na leads to out-of-bounds read. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: The Open Asset Import Library Assimp 5.4.3 has a vulnerability that could allow remote attackers to execute an out-of-bounds read attack by manipulating a specific argument. This affects users of this library and the CSM File Handler component. To mitigate this threat, users should update to the latest version of the software or apply any patches provided by the developers.

description: A vulnerability was found in Open Asset Import Library Assimp 5.4.3 and classified as problematic. This issue affects the function fast_atoreal_move in the library include/assimp/fast_atof.h of the component CSM File Handler. The manipulation leads to out-of-bounds read. To protect against this threat, users should update to a fixed version of the library when available and exercise caution when handling CSM files.
